title: openpgp: unsupported feature: unsupported cipher in private key: 2
body:
by **duane.crouch@mnxsolutions.com**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. create public/private key with gpg --gen-key
2. run code here: http://play.golang.org/p/znASRzRsNc
3. make sure to keys are exported to the right directory in above link.
4. 

What is the expected output?
public ring: [%!s(*openpgp.Entity=&{0xf84006c000 <nil> map[FirstName Last Name
<email>:0xf84003aba0] [{0xf84006c0f0 <nil> 0xf840072100}]})]
private ring: private key ring
private err: nil or []

What do you see instead?
public ring: [%!s(*openpgp.Entity=&{0xf84006c000 <nil> map[FirstName Last Name
<email>:0xf84003aba0] [{0xf84006c0f0 <nil> 0xf840072100}]})]
private ring: []
private err: openpgp: unsupported feature: unsupported cipher in private key: 2

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
gccgo

Which operating system are you using?
Centos 6.3

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')
go version go1.0.2
